BooleanValue

class naive.boolean_algebra_1.BooleanConstant(source=None, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: BooleanFunction

__abstractmethods__ = frozenset({})
__bool__()[source]

Provides support for implicit and explicit (i.e. bool(v)) conversions to bool.

Returns

the canonic mapping of BooleanConstant with the pythonic bool type.

Return type

bool

__eq__(other: CoercibleBooleanConstant) → bool[source]

Provides support for mathematical equality.

All python objects are implicitly convertible to bool, but we want the equality operator to rather approach mathematical equality. Hence, we explicitly convert other to BooleanConstant which issues warnings and raises exceptions as necessary.

Parameters

other (CoercibleBooleanConstant) – A compatible boolean object.

Returns

The truth value of the equality operator.

Return type

bool
